poem:
Title: Confrontation in Motion

In the charging veins of M1,
Wore a wolf: blue's false son.
Angry phantom, sable car,
Mocked grace of the law's star.

Lady stark against alloy and time,
Innocence parried with chicanery's crime. 
Yet justice's (blind) dove in rusty flight,
Missed the gorse, the lark, the fight.

We are vehicles, chasing God's smile,
In the rearview, sin trails a mile.
